headline: Nvidia Physical AI Partnerships Shape Lab Robotics Industrial Automation Outlook
summary: Nvidia is expanding physical AI through new partnerships in lab robotics and industrial automation. The company is working with Opentrons Labworks Inc. to use Nvidia Isaac and Cosmos in automated laboratory experiments. An ongoing collaboration with Dassault Systèmes focuses on combining Virtual Twins with AI infrastructure for industrial use. Nvidia, traded as NasdaqGS:NVDA, is pushing further into real world AI applications as its technology moves beyond data centers and into laboratories...

Nvidia, traded as NasdaqGS:NVDA, is pushing further into real world AI applications as its technology moves beyond data centers and into laboratories...

headline: Nvidia Reportedly Nears Record $20 Billion OpenAI Investment As Jensen Huang And Sam Altman Deny Reports Of Strained Partnership
summary: Jensen Huang-led Nvidia Corp (NASDAQ:NVDA) is reportedly planning to invest $20 billion in ChatGPT-maker OpenAI. Nvidia's Biggest Bet Yet On The AI Boom As part of OpenAI's latest funding round, Nvidia is close to finalizing a $20 billion investment in the AI startup, reported Bloomberg on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter. headline: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

content.title: The Robot Revolution Is Real. Tesla, Hyundai, and More Stocks to Play It.
content.summary: Once the domain of science fiction, autonomous robots—think C-3PO from Star Wars or Baymax from Big Hero 6—are getting closer by the year.  At 2025’s CES electronics conference, there were a handful of humanoids, none of which seemed to catch the world’s attention.  At January’s conference, robots, including Boston Dynamics’ Atlas, a 6-foot-2-inch automaton weighing in at just under 200 pounds with a digital smiley face, were the stars.

headline: Big Tech to Spend $650 Billion This Year as AI Race Intensifies
summary: The spending planned by Alphabet Inc., Amazon.com Inc., Meta Platforms Inc. and Microsoft Corp., all in pursuit of dominance in the still-nascent market for AI tools, is a boom without a parallel this century.  Each of the companies’ estimated outlay for this year would set a high-water mark for capital spending by any single corporation in any one of the past 10 years, according to Bloomberg data.

Each of the companies’ estimated outlay for this year would set a high-water mark for capital spending by any single corporation in any one of the past 10 years, according to Bloomberg data.

headline: Oracle’s Massive AI Push Resets Priorities And Raises Valuation Questions
summary: Oracle plans to raise about $45 billion to $50 billion through a mix of equity and debt to expand its AI focused cloud infrastructure for customers including OpenAI, Nvidia, and Meta. The company is reviewing its healthcare operations, including a potential sale of Cerner, which it acquired in 2022. Reports also point to potential layoffs affecting up to 30,000 employees as part of a broad restructuring of Oracle's operations. Oracle (NYSE: ORCL) enters this overhaul with a current share...

headline: Nvidia Stock Is in the Doldrums. Why Amazon’s Huge Spending Might Not Help.

Amazon said in its earnings report after the market closed on Thursday that it plans capital expenditure of $200 billion in 2026, a nearly 60% increase from last year and far above Wall Street expectations.

headline: Global chip sales expected to hit $1 trillion this year, industry group says
summary: Global semiconductor sales are expected to hit $1 trillion this year, the Semiconductor ​Industry Association said on Friday.  The group, which represents ‌most U.S. chip firms, said that chip sales hit $791.7 billion in 2025, an ‌increase of 25.6% over the previous year.  The growth leader and largest segment of chips was the ‍kind of advanced computing chips made by Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices and Intel.

content.title: Global chip sales expected to hit $1 trillion this year, industry group says
content.summary: Global semiconductor sales are expected to hit $1 trillion this year, the Semiconductor ​Industry Association said on Friday.  The group, which represents ‌most U.S. chip firms, said that chip sales hit $791.7 billion in 2025, an ‌increase of 25.6% over the previous year.  The growth leader and largest segment of chips was the ‍kind of advanced computing chips made by Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices and Intel.

headline: Wall Street bounces back as tech stocks recover and bitcoin stops plunging
summary: Wall Street is bouncing back from big losses taken earlier in the week, as technology stocks recover some of their losses on Friday and bitcoin halts its plunge, at least for now.  The S&P 500 rose 0.9% and was heading for just its second gain in the last eight days.  Chip companies helped drive the gains, and Nvidia rallied 4.9% to trim its loss for the week, which came into the day at just over 10%.

content.title: Wall Street bounces back as tech stocks recover and bitcoin stops plunging

Chip companies helped drive the gains, and Nvidia rallied 4.9% to trim its loss for the week, which came into the day at just over 10%.

content.summary: Amazon said it will spend $200B in 2026, exceeding expectations, citing strong demand and opportunities across AI, semiconductors, robotics, and low earth orbit satellites.

headline: Is It Worth Investing in Nvidia (NVDA) Based on Wall Street's Bullish Views?
summary: The average brokerage recommendation (ABR) for Nvidia (NVDA) is equivalent to a Buy. The overly optimistic recommendations of Wall Street analysts make the effectiveness of this highly sought-after metric questionable. So, is it worth buying the stock?
